headline: James Galbraith, economist: 'The Fed is an agency created by Congress, controlled by it, and accountable to it'
subhead: The US inflation decline did not result from action by the Federal Reserve and a reduction in interest rates would therefore be justified, said the University of Texas professor in an interview with Le Monde. However, in his view, Trump should've let the Republican majority in both chambers of Congress pressure the central bank.

headline: Ukraine says Abu Dhabi talks with Russia 'substantive and productive'
Last US-Russia nuclear treaty ends in 'grave moment' for world
Democracy is fading in Africa as the world looks away
subhead: While global powers covet Africa's natural resources, they have paid little attention to the wave of coups that have swept the continent in recent years.

headline: 'The Mastermind,' by filmmaker Kelly Reichardt: The art of losing oneself
subhead: In telling the story of an art heist gone awry, the director paints a somber and disillusioned portrait of the 1970s.

headline: The traditional blouse immortalized by Matisse becomes a political symbol in Romania
subhead: The far right has turned this blouse with flared sleeves and colorful embroidery into a nationalist emblem. Once again a source of cultural pride after the 1989 revolution in Romania, it now finds itself at the heart of political appropriation.

headline: Robbie Williams, the nostalgic pop star
subhead: For more than 30 years, the British singer has ridden a wave of global success, releasing hit after hit and filling stadiums. At 51, still in the media spotlight that once burned him, the former boy band member remains a tireless entertainer. Now on a mega tour across Europe, he has just released his 13th album, a nod to the vibrant 1990s Britpop scene that always snubbed him.

headline: NBC 'Today' host Savannah Guthrie pleads with her mother's alleged kidnapper: 'We are ready to talk'
Relations between South Africa and Israel hit new low amid fears of US reprisals
French far right's EU embezzlement was 'directed by' Le Pen, prosecutors argue
European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
France's North Atlantic overseas territory sees 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump among residents
French Navy seizes over 4 metric tons of cocaine in the South Pacific
Michael Jackson film reveals previously unheard clips of thoughts on children
Foreign language learning holds strong against the AI wave
Man sentenced to life in prison for plotting to kill Trump in 2024
In Gaza, the fate of thousands missing remains unknown
Trump's new border chief removes 700 immigration officers from Minnesota
'To revive a strong integration policy, it must become a government priority, separate from the issue of immigration'
Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhead: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: Artificial snow takes a toll on the environment
subhead: The Milan Cortina Olympic Games are no exception: Artificial snowmaking will be used almost everywhere. This technology, which requires large amounts of water and energy, has led to major infrastructure changes that have been criticized by environmental advocates and scientists.

headline: French Sénat condemned for silence over ex-senator found guilty of drugging MP
subhead: Publicly questioned by the victim, MP Sandrine Josso, Sénat President Gérard Larcher has, for the first time, expressed his public support for her.

headline: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
'The race toward the geopolitical grotesque must be taken very seriously'
